page.title: 11Wheatley Hill Fire Station
page.content: The Fire Station was built in 1955. At the time it was built it had one fire engine and this was welcomed by the community for the security it provided. Before this a fire engine had to travel ten miles to the fire. The only addition since 1955 has been the provision of an extra appliance. The large doors needed to be altered because the new engine was too high. {Sixteen men}work at the station working shifts to give round the clock protection. There are{eleven rooms}including the drying room, engine room, watch room and officer-in-charge room. When asked about improvements the men said that they would like more new equipment, especially a training tower to help with their practice.
